memories.name: Learning Goals Q1 2026
memories.episode_body: Want to deepen knowledge of distributed tracing and observability patterns. Planning to get AWS Solutions Architect certification. Need to improve documentation writing - feedback from Alice in last review.

memories.name: Work Schedule Preference
memories.episode_body: Prefer to do deep coding work early morning 7-10 AM before meetings. Reserve afternoons for code reviews, meetings, and collaboration. Usually take lunch break 12-1 PM.

memories.name: Bob Martinez - Senior Backend Engineer
memories.episode_body: Bob Martinez is Senior Backend Engineer on Backend Team at TechFlow Solutions, reporting to Alice Chen. Expert in Python/FastAPI development, microservices architecture, payment gateway integrations, and distributed systems. 6 years backend engineering experience.

memories.name: Payment Gateway Integration Experience
memories.episode_body: Bob has integrated multiple payment gateways including Stripe, PayPal, and Square. Deep knowledge of PCI compliance requirements, webhook handling, idempotency patterns, and payment reconciliation flows.

memories.name: Kafka Event Schema Design
memories.episode_body: For payment service events, designed schemas using Avro format. Key events: PaymentInitiated, PaymentCompleted, PaymentFailed, RefundRequested. All events include correlation_id for tracing and idempotency_key for deduplication.

memories.name: Payment Service Current Architecture
memories.episode_body: Payment service handles checkout, payment processing, and refunds. Uses FastAPI for REST endpoints, Celery for async tasks, PostgreSQL for transaction storage. Current deployment: 3 replicas behind load balancer, average response time 150ms, handles 500 req/sec at peak.

memories.name: Idempotency in Payment Systems
memories.episode_body: Idempotency ensures that duplicate requests (due to retries or network issues) don't cause duplicate charges. Implementation uses idempotency keys stored in Redis with 24-hour TTL. If key exists, return cached response instead of processing again.

memories.name: Payment Service Deployment Requirements
memories.episode_body: Service requires environment variables: DATABASE_URL, REDIS_URL, KAFKA_BROKERS, STRIPE_API_KEY (secret). Needs PostgreSQL 14+, Redis 7+, Kafka 3.0+. Runs on port 8080. Health check endpoint: /health. Requires 2GB RAM minimum per container.

memories.name: Recent Bug Fix - Duplicate Charges
memories.episode_body: Fixed critical bug on January 15, 2026 where concurrent requests could cause duplicate charges. Root cause: race condition in payment processing. Solution: Added distributed lock using Redis before charging payment method. Deployed hotfix within 2 hours.
